Message about our hiring and operating practices during the COVID-19 pandemic

The Canadian Mental Health York Region and South Simcoe branch (CMHA-YRSS) is continuing to provide much-needed mental health services. As an organization, we are protecting our staff through supporting either working from home, or physical distancing, and other public health directives for essential services staff working on-site. Rest assured that your well-being is our top priority and we have appropriate health and safety measures in place at each stage of the recruiting process and throughout our operations.

DATA/APPLICATION ANALYST – INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

Competition #: 2020-028

We are hiring a Data/Application Analyst in our Information Technology Department!

The role of the Data/Application Analyst plays an integral role in the provision of information, analysis and business intelligence and application maintenance/development to support mental health services, planning decisions, and strategy development leading to improved client care.

Are you an individual who can work with databases and flat files, use excel spreadsheets and apply analytical skills to maintain data integrity across various sources/applications, and analyze and present data in the form of reports and scorecards? If yes, then this position is for you! We are looking for a natural problem-solver who enjoys working on a variety of technical and customer applications to improve data capture (CRUD, Create Read Update and Delete), workflow processes and data-sharing. We want you to join our team and support diversity, encourage teamwork, and be part of an amazing organization.

Contract, Full-time (1 Year until May 21, 2021), 35 hours per week, evenings and weekends may be required

Comprehensive Health Benefits: Extended health and dental coverage provided after waiting period.

Location: In accordance with current public health directives, training will be available remotely for staff (i.e., via teleconference and videoconferencing technologies) and work can be delivered from home. Once public health directives are lifted, the Data/Application Analyst will be working primarily in our Vaughan office (8271 Keele Street, Vaughan, ON, L4K 1Y2), however will be required to travel within York Region & South Simcoe to our other program offices, including Markham, Vaughan, Aurora and Alliston on occasion.

Job Profile:
The Data/Application Analyst interacts cross-functionally with a variety of teams and executives within CMHA to identify process inefficiencies reporting gaps by researching tools (hardware/software), new processes and reports and provide/implement business recommendations and solutions. They are the subject matter expert on RingCentral VoIP, UCC (Unified Communication and Collaboration). S/he is expected to support the System Administrators to maintain the corporate network, hardware and software as well as support users through the ticketing system, Team viewer and face-to-face user interaction.

S/he will report to and consult with the Senior Director, Digital Strategy & Experience, interact cross-functionally with a variety of teams and executives to identify opportunities and to make business recommendations leveraging analytics techniques and tools, as well as act as a consultant on issues with respect to reporting and application best practices.
In addition to compliance with all organizational policies and procedures, the incumbent is also expected to behave ethically, demonstrate competence in effective communication and team building, demonstrate effectiveness in working in a collaborative environment, and demonstrate confidence in decision-making and in building relationships.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in such as Computer Science, Science, Math or related discipline
2+ years of relevant work experience dealing with various applications such as CRM, Active Directory, and Geographic Information Systems
Experience using SQL to query, cleanse, integrate and aggregate data from various sources
Knowledge of and experience with: CRM, SQL, scripting languages, business intelligence tools such as Excel, Tableau
Second language (Cantonese, Mandarin, Farsi or Tamil, Italian, Korean, Punjabi, Russian, Urdu) reflecting the local community is an asset.
Knowledge of the Ontario Mental Health Act, mental health reform principles, the Substitute Decisions Act, the Health Care Consent Act and PHIPPA requirements.
Excellent computer skills required, including Microsoft Office
Strong Report writing experience using tools such as Crystal, MS SSRS or Actuate.
Experience with statistical packages such as SAS, SPSS or R
A valid Canadian Full G driver’s license, a minimum $1,000,000 third party liability insurance and proof that insurance covers use of personal vehicle to transport clients
A satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Screening (Police Check)
Working Conditions: Office work. Sitting at a desk using a computer up to 7 hours a day and communicating over the phone for periods of time.

Disclaimer: In keeping with Mental Health reform, best practices, funding and direction, this position may later require knowledge, skills, abilities and working conditions not noted here.

Why work for CMHA-York Region and South Simcoe?

We are a team committed to our vision of mental health support for all. That means we respect that our clients are the experts in their recovery journey and that our role is to provide support, resources and opportunities based on their hopes and dreams. It means that we foster and encourage an entrepreneurial spirit to create, implement, and sustain innovative, evidence based and transformational impact. We seek out and build partnerships, collaborate and share knowledge to be the most culturally competent team and fully integrated service delivery partner.

Our team cares for each other. We have our own team values of trust, respect, teamwork and communication. We have been a National Nonprofit Employer of Choice for four consecutive years as well as a recipient of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures.

IIROC is the national, self-regulatory organization responsible for oversight of Canada’s investment dealers, as well as trading activities on debt and equity marketplaces. In this role you will have an opportunity to be part of the IIROC Enforcement team which is responsible for the administration of its Dealer Member Rules and the Universal Market Integrity Rules (UMIR).

Reporting to the Manager of Market Investigations, the Senior Data Analyst, Investigations will play a key role in reviewing Enforcement’s current analytical tools and developing new tools based on existing technologies. This includes developing and implementing quantitative methodologies to enhance the investigational program and better use technologies for visualization and dissemination of information.

Key Responsibilities:
Design and build quantitative analytic processes that provide statistical analysis of market related issues and infractions.
Develop new tools to streamline and automate current computational processes and analytics related to all investigations.
Perform in-depth analysis on transactions and market data to generate reports for business users.
Assist Enforcement management in developing tools related to management information systems.
Build visualization tools for interpretation of market participants trading strategies.
Build training modules and educate team members on optimal use of newly developed processes.

Education

Masters level degree in the relevant fields (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Math, Physics, Information Management, Finance, Economics) or relevant experience that heavily emphasis on analytical skills.
The Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Trader Training Course are considered as assets.

Experience/Skills/Special Requirements

Experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL from relational databases/warehouses (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access) as well as working with large scale datasets.
Must have experience coding in programming language such as Python, JAVA, MATLAB, R for quantitative analysis or data mining. Expert in MS Excel, experience using Microsoft CRM and Office 365
Expertise with visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI.
Strong working knowledge of the functioning of the capital markets, including a deep understanding of trading systems, practices, and market activities.
A working knowledge of trading strategies of participants and their clients, experience as a quantitative analyst of equities a definite asset.
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
Work well in a collaborative and inclusive team environment.

While we appreciate all applicants, only those who most closely match the position requirements will be contacted for interview.

Analyste principal des données d’enquête

Mise en application

Toronto

Emploi permanent à plein temps

L’OCRCVM est l’organisme d’autoréglementation national chargé de surveiller l’ensemble des courtiers en placement et l’ensemble des opérations effectuées sur les marchés des titres de capitaux propres et les marchés des titres de créance au Canada. Le titulaire fera partie de l’équipe de la Mise en application de l’OCRCVM, qui a pour responsabilité d’administrer les Règles des courtiers membres et les Règles universelles d’intégrité du marché (RUIM) de l’OCRCVM.

Relevant du chef des enquêtes sur les marchés, l’analyste principal des données d’enquête jouera un rôle clé dans l’examen des outils analytiques actuels de l’équipe de la Mise en application et l’élaboration de nouveaux outils en fonction des technologies existantes. Il devra notamment concevoir et mettre en œuvre des méthodes quantitatives qui permettront d’améliorer le programme d’enquête et de mieux utiliser les technologies de visualisation et de diffusion de l’information.

Principales responsabilités

Concevoir et mettre en place des processus d’analyse quantitative permettant d’analyser statistiquement les problèmes et les contraventions qui se rapportent aux marchés
Concevoir de nouveaux outils visant à simplifier et à automatiser les processus informatiques et les fonctions d’analyse qui se rattachent à toutes les enquêtes
Effectuer des analyses exhaustives des opérations et des données relatives aux marchés afin de produire des rapports à l’intention des utilisateurs
Aider la direction de l’équipe de la Mise en application à concevoir des outils qui se rattachent aux systèmes de gestion de l’information
Élaborer des outils de visualisation pour interpréter les stratégies de négociation des participants aux marchés
Créer des modules de formation et donner de la formation aux membres de l’équipe sur l’usage optimal des procédés nouvellement créés

Formation

Diplôme universitaire de deuxième cycle dans un domaine pertinent (informatique, génie, statistique, mathématiques, physique, gestion de l’information, finance, économie) ou expérience pertinente mettant l’accent sur les compétences analytiques
Réussite du Cours sur le commerce des valeurs mobilières au Canada (CCVM) et du Cours de formation à l’intention des négociateurs (CFN), un atout

Expérience, aptitudes et exigences particulières

Expérience de l’extraction et de la manipulation de données au moyen de SQL à partir de bases ou d’entrepôts de données relationnels (Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access, etc.), et expérience des grands ensembles de données
Expérience du codage en langages de programmation tels que Python, JAVA, MATLAB et R aux fins de l’analyse quantitative ou de l’extraction de données; maîtrise du logiciel Excel de Microsoft et expérience de l’utilisation des outils Microsoft CRM et Office 365
Maîtrise d’outils de visualisation tels que Power BI de Microsoft
Excellente connaissance pratique du fonctionnement des marchés financiers, dont une compréhension poussée des systèmes et des pratiques de négociation et des activités menées sur les marchés
Connaissance pratique des stratégies de négociation des participants et de leurs clients; expérience de l’analyse quantitative des titres de capitaux propres, un atout certain
Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication orale et écrite, et pour la présentation d’exposés
Aptitude à travailler en équipe, dans un milieu axé sur la collaboration et l’inclusion

L’OCRCVM remercie tous les candidats pour leur intérêt. Toutefois, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

Reporting to Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Operations, you will play a key role in a highly visible team within the organization to advance our business as we execute our data strategy. Bachelor degree with exceptional academic standing, and/or master degree(s) in an analytical discipline such as: mathematics, applied science and engineering, physics, computer science, management analytics, data science
5+ years of professional experience in analytics or other quantitative disciplines
5+ years in VBA, SQL and Python
Experience in modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research, management science and data mining
Experience in problem solving and analytical skills to develop creative, unique and pragmatic approaches and solutions to address complex problems
Proven analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Technology experience in one or more of the following: Python, SQL, VBA, Scala, R, MATLAB, C/C++/C#, Java, Go, Tensorflow, Julia; Data visualization tools such as MS SSRS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI, D3, SAP BO Web Intelligence / Lumira, Apache Dash; NoSQL databases such as Hbase, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis; Cloud services platform (e.g, Azure, AWS) and analytics tools (e.g, Databricks, Snowflake)
Business domain knowledge in one or more of the following: Sales and Marketing, Product Development and Product Management, Call Center Operations, Billing and Collections, Field, Fleet and Supply Chain Operations
Interest in staying current on emerging trends in software development, RPA and advanced analytics
Experience in API design and development is a plus
Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats such as unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image is a plus
Experience developing and using virtualization, container-based and cloud platforms such as
Experience in SFDC (Salesforce), Microsoft Dynamics, Click, and/or JIRA is a plus
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Experience working in a start-up environment is a plus

Monday, February 24, 2020

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Therapeutics brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Applications and as part of the IT SAP support / project team, the SAP Master Data Analyst will work within the ERP master data team to complete master data setup and input within SAP S4/Hana. The candidate will provide support service to the North American corporate branches to ensure accurate and efficient input of master data into SAP.

Responsibilities
Responsible for the timely entry and upload of new master data in SAP
Understand the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data
Understand any data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems and the PI/PO process
Support the development, implementation and maintenance of internal controls to ensure best business practices when creating master data in SAP
Ensure master data entry to company standards to permit effective data set up and minimize master data issues leading to residual issues
Liaise directly with Data Stewards to clarify and ensure data accuracy and ensure company standard maintenance
Periodic auditing to ensure master data integrity
Liaise with other Support Centre departments to maintain centralized data elements
Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and completeness
Assist in setting up of any new divisional objectives (i.e. new operating entities, organizational changes, new products, etc.)
Resolve end user trouble tickets in a timely manner in compliance with the team SLA
Other duties as assigned
Experience
2+ years working with SAP (S4/Hana is an asset) and experience within the Order to Cash (O2C), Procure to Pay (P2P), Plan to Manufacture (PTM) or Record to Report (R2R) business streams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated skills in creative thinking, problem solving and decision-making
Proven attention to detail
Advanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis
Strong organizational and project management skills
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical users.
Proven ability to manage multiple competing deliverables simultaneously
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment, perform effectively under dynamic conditions
Proven ability to develop strong working relationships with all stakeholders and team members
Superior communication skills in English including effectively interacting with all levels of an organization
Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Kanata, ON.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst – Enterprise Data and Analytics
Job Description:
The Enterprise Data and Analytics (EDA) team is responsible for designing and implementing a holistic data strategy that supports Real Matters’ operational and strategic goals. Reporting to the VP of Enterprise Data and Analytics, the Technical Business Analyst is responsible for ensuring the technical and functional requirements for our data products are well defined and reflect the long-term needs and values of our users.

Responsibilities include:
Collaborate with clients and technical teams to design underlying data flow architecture and systems that are required to support the data products and reporting needs of our users.
Prepare and maintain comprehensive documentation to support data governance and product development initiatives including data flow diagrams and metric definitions.
Build reports, dashboards and visualizations that leverage multiple data sources and provide actionable insights for EDA team and stakeholders. Gather feedback and drive the build, measure, learn process.
Ensure data integrity by providing QA and UAT support as well as investigating any reporting anomalies.
Support EDA team responsibilities including BI tool maintenance and ad-hoc analysis requests.
Work closely with EDA team and stakeholders to define EDA product roadmap priorities.

Qualifications:
Master’s degree in quantitative discipline preferred (Computer Science, Analytics, etc).
3-5+ years of Experience as a Business Analyst
Technical or development experience implementing BI and data visualization tools and systems (Tableau, Qlik, etc.).
Experience developing custom BI reports and dashboards using analytics tools and building complex database queries. Experience using SQL, R and Python.
Experience in mortgage services industry preferred.
Experience preparing and maintaining technical documentation and performing data governance process support.
Strong understanding of agile, scrum and lean start-up practices including data driven product development strategies and tactics.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills; ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst Enterprise Data and Analytics
Job Description:
The Enterprise Data and Analytics (EDA) team is responsible for designing and implementing a holistic data strategy that supports Real Matters’ operational and strategic goals. Reporting to the VP of Enterprise Data and Analytics, the Technical Business Analyst is responsible for ensuring the technical and functional requirements for our data products are well defined and reflect the long-term needs and values of our users.

Responsibilities include:
Collaborate with clients and technical teams to design underlying data flow architecture and systems that are required to support the data products and reporting needs of our users.
Prepare and maintain comprehensive documentation to support data governance and product development initiatives including data flow diagrams and metric definitions.
Build reports, dashboards and visualizations that leverage multiple data sources and provide actionable insights for EDA team and stakeholders. Gather feedback and drive the build, measure, learn process.
Ensure data integrity by providing QA and UAT support as well as investigating any reporting anomalies.
Support EDA team responsibilities including BI tool maintenance and ad-hoc analysis requests.
Work closely with EDA team and stakeholders to define EDA product roadmap priorities.
Qualifications:
Master’s degree in quantitative discipline preferred (Computer Science, Analytics, etc).
3-5+ years of Experience as a Business Analyst
Technical or development experience implementing BI and data visualization tools and systems (Tableau, Qlik, etc.).
Experience developing custom BI reports and dashboards using analytics tools and building complex database queries. Experience using SQL, R and Python.
Experience in mortgage services industry preferred.
Experience preparing and maintaining technical documentation and performing data governance process support.
Strong understanding of agile, scrum and lean start-up practices including data driven product development strategies and tactics.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills; ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

For the description please refer to the French version - CLICK HERE

• The business data analyst would be responsible to write functional requirements, perform data analysis, data profiling and data mappings, support UAT

Forms Analyst - Health Data Resources

Department:
Information Systems Analysts

Centenary/General/Birchmount

Contract Duration:

Across our three hospitals and eight satellite sites, Scarborough Health Network (SHN) is shaping the future of care. Our many programs and services are designed around the needs of one of Canada’s most vibrant and diverse communities. We are home to North America’s largest nephrology program, as well as the designated cardiac care and spine centre for Scarborough and surrounding communities to the east. We are proud to be a community-affiliated teaching site for the University of Toronto and partner with a number of other universities and colleges, helping to train the next generation of health care professionals. Learn more at shn.ca

The completion of this online form serves as your application and will be used to determine if you meet the requirements of this position. Please ensure that you have provided all pertinent information necessary to be considered for this vacancy by the close date.

Reporting to Health Records, you will be responsible for the management of all clinical forms, including development, revision and artwork.. Responsible for engaging end users, facilitating form requests and navigating end users through the Clinical Documentation Advisory Committee (CDAC) process. Provide guidance through the forms approvals and sign-off processes.

Responsible for configuring all chart forms in the OnBase configuration application module and Meditech (Medical Records Forms module). Update the SHN forms repository for Centenary and General/Birchmount. Provide updated list of new/revised forms to external scanning vendor and monitor Onbase for batches of scanned documents. Perform other associated duties as directed.

Requirements:


• Health Informatics Diploma
• Completion of medical terminology program
• Comprehensive knowledge of informatics related computer systems and other applications, forms development software, MS Excel spreadsheets, database applications and MS Power-point.
• Advance level of written and oral communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization and develop and maintain respectful interpersonal relations
• Ability to work independently, take initiative and prioritize workload to meet deadlines is essential
• Demonstrate attention to detail
• Understanding of privacy legislation including the Personal Health Information Act and the Public Hospitals′ Act.
• Ability to respect and promote confidentiality and to display independent judgment
• Demonstrates an understanding of and commitment to SHN's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, infection control and environmental safety and participates in regular in-service education in this area
• Demonstrates a commitment to customer service when dealing with patients, colleagues, volunteers and other members of the community and public
• Demonstrates values consistent with SHN′s Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
• Utilize protective equipment provided and identify and reports hazards
• Engages in ethical conduct and strives to understand and appreciate the diversity of our patient/staff population and community
• Excellent work performance and attendance

Asset:


• Health Informatics Degree preferred
• 2 years′ experience as Forms development (graphic design)
• Knowledge of health records chart processes

Scarborough Health Network (SHN) embraces and celebrates our community’s unique multicultural heritage and diversity. SHN is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a culture of inclusiveness and diversity reflecting our diverse patients, staff and community alike. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Job Title: Quality Control Senior Analyst – Data Review
Job Description:
Job Summary…

The QC Analytical Science & Technology (AS&T) Sr. Analyst, Data Review is responsible for ensuring that all data review procedure(s) are operating in a compliant manner. The functions within AS&T data review include laboratory-controlled worksheet review, and review of lab note book, laboratory records, QC studies, raw data, instrument audit trail, and lab investigation reports.

Sr. Analysts, Data review are assigned documentation review responsibilities based on their functional mastery and experience. The Sr. Analyst, Data review will apply in-depth knowledge of relevant guidance/regulatory documents, perform and lead routine and non-routine testing activities to include review of analytical method validations, analytical method transfers, product/process investigations, The AS&T Sr. Analyst, Data review will be responsible for planning of his/her respective projects and assignments, providing technical support, and interfacing with QC Microbiologists and Chemistry (QC Operations) analysts in support of completion of compliant lab documentation.

This position is expected to maintain operational and GMP readiness of the QC areas. Based on the level of this position, the individual in the Senior Analyst role is expected to participate in more complex projects. In addition, the Sr. Analyst AS&T will participate in lab operational excellence initiatives and various lab quality systems (deviations, change controls, lab investigations) with little to no supervision. The Sr. Analyst may be asked to take on a lead role for the QC organization on these projects. This position is expected to act as a role model for junior staff in the various QC areas.

The challenges of the job…

Your key duties and responsibilities include:
Perform detailed data review for analytical test results generated by QC department for compliance with cGMP, internal SOPs and Specifications to support production, stability studies and lab operation.

Review release and stability data, trend charts of reference standards, lab equipment calibration records and log-books and other review function as needed. Testing encompasses both microbiological assay, biochemistry and instrumental analyses including but not limited to:

TOC Analyzer

Atomic Absorption Spectroscopy (AAS)

IR Spectroscopy

Gas chromatography

HPLC

UV – Vis Spectrophotometer

Refractometer

Ion chromatography

ELISA testing

Compendial Methods such as pH, Osmolality, and Appearance.

Microbiological identification systems

Microbial enumeration testing

Performs and coordinates laboratory investigations for unexpected results working with cross functional teams to identify root cause and corrective actions

Performs detailed data review for analytical test results generated by QC chemistry and microbiology labs to assure their correctness and accuracy and help them with failure investigation.

Maintains and updates relevant SOPs for data review and reporting as needed

Interact with Stability and other peer groups to support stability report writing and regulatory updates.

Complies with all pertinent regulatory agency requirements.

Participates in required training activities.

May be responsible for supporting and maintaining a special project for data review.

Lead-Related Activities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Provides on-the-floor guidance and support to lab analysts and microbiologist as related to laboratory documentation;

Monitors employees training to ensure that all requirements are met, including OJT and lab proficiency

Maintains up to date training records for self and facilitates/supports compilation of training for QC staff

As a senior analyst, leads, implements and reports on site AS&T requirements / programs / projects in compliance with GMP and internal requirements.

Supports planning, execution and completion of data review requirements as well as other AS&T related operational activities.

Interprets the analytical data, analyzes trends and provides conclusions (e.g. shelf life assessment, storage conditions)

Excellent communication both verbal and written skills concerning testing and data reporting scheduling with other departments.

Professional and skilled interface with auditors.

Work is performed under general direction with little supervision. Participates in determining objectives of assignments. Plans scheduled and arranges own activities in accomplishing objectives of the laboratory department. Work will be reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. This role may be responsible for reviewing the work of more junior analysts and providing training on analytical methods and techniques.

Performs all lab functions in compliance with cGMP. The Sr. Analyst must have a mastery of a broad range of techniques in order to support the Analytical Science & Technology team. Analyst must have a mastery on lab information systems, lab computer systems and compliant review of instrument audit trails.

Supports and facilitates the continued implementation and maintenance of the lab data integrity program; provide DI training and coaching to team.

Supports the implementation of Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).

Collaborates with QC Manager to optimize laboratory efficiencies, support lab coordination and provide input to lab procedures and processes.

Do you have…

The following qualifications and skills :
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline (Biochemistry, Chemistry, Microbiology, Biotechnology) and experience in a Biotech or pharmaceutical QC Laboratory required. GMP experience required.

A subject matter expert level knowledge of the cGMP QC laboratory environment, and equipment associated with testing of biopharmaceutical products

Related experience: 6 to 8 years of working experience in a GMP laboratory role. Minimum 5 years within QC (method development, method validation, stability testing).

Expert knowledge of USP, Ph. Eur. Pharmacopeia. Advanced to expert knowledge of cGMPs, ICH guidelines, good documentation practices and data integrity requirements. Experience in risk management and project management.

Proven track record with regulatory inspections (Health Canada/FDA/EMA or other)

Job Title: Spécialiste en Analyse des données / Data Analyst

Job Description:
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?

Loblaw Head Office

Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Are you at the top of your game? Bring your expertise and knowledge to Canada’s largest retailer. We are looking for innovative, talented, and energetic people to help bring our Data Insights & Analytics game to the next level. This is an exciting time to join our team – we are changing the game in a big way! If you are looking to join a company that offers unlimited opportunity, excellent leadership, world-class training and makes a big impact on the community – this is the role you’ve been waiting for!

The Data Insights & Analytics team at Loblaw is seeking a Senior Data Analyst with background in big data, cloud and relational databases. We are currently in the process of modernizing the data infrastructure onto cloud technologies to unlock the value of our data and drive richer insights to our business partners.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Management, the incumbent will support large data initiatives by leveraging their expertise in obtaining, analyzing and manipulating data to identify insights and data patterns. He or she will be responsible for creating and maintaining data requirements, transformations and system documentation.

What You'll Do:
Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases.
Provide support to Data Governance initiatives such as data quality, data lineage and metadata management.
Transform extracted data from large and disconnected datasets into insights suitable for presentation to various audiences.
Develop capabilities to identify areas of opportunity and improve business processes, data architecture and reporting efficiency.
Work collaboratively with business and analytics groups, on cross functional projects and data initiatives to solve business problems.
Extract, review and prepare data for analysis & reporting using SQL and/or Python.
Creation of UML diagrams including but not limited to sequence and data flow diagrams.
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information.

What You'll Bring:
Mandatory: Advanced SQL querying for data mining, extraction and preparation.
University Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Information Systems is preferred.
Minimum 5 years of experience in utilizing advanced data extraction and manipulation tools (MS SQL, Teradata, etc.).
Minimum 5 years of experience in Data mining working with large relational databases.
Technical background with a solid understanding of database design is an asset.
Experience with Hadoop and understanding of its components (HDFS, HBase, Spark) is an asset.
Experience with Cloud technologies (GCP, Azure) is an asset.
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data.
Demonstrated knowledge of the data management lifecycle, including experience with data quality and metadata management.
Experience in conducting business analysis to gather requirements from non-technical stakeholders.
A Team player and self-starter with the ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

What You Can Expect:
We are a team of diverse and ambitious analysts, who cultivate a friendly and inclusive work environment where you can be yourself. Our employees’ development is at the core of our business, offering endless possibilities for growth, learning and mobility. Let us help grow your skills through one of our many resources including the Loblaw Virtual Learning Centre, where you have access to hundreds of learning tools, or through casual coffee chats with our leaders who were once in your shoes.

Other perks of joining Loblaw:
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Office with incredible amenities including an on-site gym, volleyball court and basketball court (turned ice rink in the winter!)
A flexible work environment which values balance
Colleague Discount Program
Tuition reimbursement Program
Employee Share Ownership plan
Pension Plan

If the above sounds like a great fit, then we would love to hear from you! Apply today, and get the process started. If you meet the above requirements, expect a call from one of our recruiters, followed by an in-person interview. Our recruitment process will allow you to meet and interact with colleagues at various levels of our business to give you a great perspective of life at Loblaw.

We thank all candidates for their interest but please note, those candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position will be contacted.

How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.

If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?

Job Summary

The Data Governance team is charged with ensuring that data is treated as a strategic asset. It is a governing body that partners with the business and IT to ensure a high level of reporting integrity with the objective of improving operations and mitigating risk.

The Sr. Analyst plays a key role in developing, socializing, and monitoring adherence to data and reporting standards, as well as governing access and consumption of data. The scope of engagements will be related to various subject areas including master data, finance, operational performance, loyalty, and inventory among others. The position will also participate in all aspects of the administration of the core data and analytics tools such as GCP, SQL Server, MicroStrategy Visual Insight, Power BI, and SAP HANA.

What you'll do
Define and govern data accessibility based on roles and permissions for various toolsets
Develop reporting requirements to monitor data compliance
Develop and maintain data and reporting standards to ensure consistency across the Enterprise
Review solutions for adherence to report and information standards as part of monthly IT releases and PTP (promote to production) processes
Manage and maintain metadata repositories (BI Data Dictionary, Reporting Catalogue)
Conduct ad hoc analysis and validate data integrity across systems
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve data accuracy
Collaborate with the Learning and Development team to ensure all training documentation is complete and up to date
Business support to enable a data-driven culture (communication, training)
Collaborate with the business to ensure reporting complies with standards
Manage and maintain monitoring scorecards and work with stakeholders to drive action on metrics or trends that conflict with policies
What you'll need
Post-secondary education or equivalent experiencein Information Management, Records Management, Data Management, Computer Science, Business or relevant discipline
Effectivelyinteract with a variety of teams and level of management within all parts of the organization with confidence
Self starter and takes initiative to consistently deliver value
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Highly organized with ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.
Team player with strong interpersonal skills
Data governance experiences in a highly regulated environment is an asset (e.g. Banking, Healthcare)
Knowledge of GCP, Azure, Teradata, metadata management tools (e.g. EDC, Collibra), data quality tools (e.g. DSP or Informatica DQ) and business intelligence tools (e.g. Microstrategy, BigQuery or SAS) is an asset
Experience with SQL is an asset

Data Analyst Team Lead

Citis Innovation labs is a global network of innovation centers focused on delivering cutting edge solutions to Citis Capital Markets, Securities Services and Banking lines of businesses.

Our Mission is to create a competitive advantage for our clients, manifested as change in the way they operate, by providing innovative technological solutions with strong client engagement, from idea to production, and by leveraging the entrepreneurship spirit.

We are currently looking for an excellent data analyst team lead to join one of our cutting edge trade surveillance solutions. It is a highly advanced trade monitoring and analytics product used globally among Citis trading desks.

Job Description
Recruit and Manage a team of talented data analysts
Explore and analyze datasets to develop new robust controls
Work with business partners to design new workflows to transform business requirements into concrete insights
Onboard data across the various financial markets via multiple consumption methods (Message buses, SFTP, SQL connectors)
Develop automated procedures to improve and optimize existing controls
Work together with the R&D team to help guide the Platform roadmap
Experience & Qualifications
Experience managing data/business analysts
Strong leadership and management skills
Ability to manage senior stakeholder relationships
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to details and accuracy
Solid experience in working with data and relational / non-relational databases
Hands-on experience in Scripting Languages (Python / R)
Experience in troubleshooting code and logs advantage
Experience in Linux Advantage
BS/BA in Software Engineering or Computer Science advantage, or in Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics

Why join us?
The Senior Data Governance Analyst works with the Manager, Information Management in the development and implementation of Oxford’s Data Governance program, including making contributions that raise the profile and understanding of Program principles and best practices across the organization.

The Senior Analyst will play a pivotal role in defining data governance across the enterprise and creating standards, policies and procedures to support this. This role will work closely with other data teams across the enterprise to ensure data governance standards and best practices are being applied consistently across the organization.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:Data Governance Policy Implementation and Maintenance:
Working with business and other IT stakeholders develop a comprehensive data governance strategy according to industry standards and best practices that:
Define and govern data accessibility based on roles and permissions for various toolsets
Develops reporting requirements to monitor data compliance as well as KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of the data governance program
Develops and maintains data and reporting standards to ensure consistency across the organization
Clearly defines a quality standard for the data lake
Managing and maintaining metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data)
Data Governance Program Communications and Training:
Developing appropriate materials and conduct training sessions related to data governance best practices and technologies
Coordinating and managing the data stewardship program
Developing a communication plan to keep the business informed about data governance standards and best practices
Ensuring appropriate data governance materials are available on the Information Management and Governance (IMG) community page
Data Technology Design and Maintenance:
Conducting ad hoc analysis and validate data integrity across systems
Collaborating with stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve data accuracy and ensure that data owners are accountable for data quality
Providing inputs on the design and development of data models for data warehousing and cataloging projects
Liaising with IT regarding the development of new IM and data related applications, including requirements validation and testing.
Providing data governance consulting services to Global process and capability teams
IM Leadership:
Leading data governance initiatives for the IMG team
Managing Data Governance Analyst
Supervising practicum and/or co-op students, where required
Assisting Manager, as required
To succeed in this role, you have:
Master’s degree in Library and Information Sciences or equivalent
Three to five years of experience in a data governance role defining standards and best practices
Experience defining data quality and metadata management standards
Working knowledge of SQL
Ability to use Microsoft Excel to assess data quality
Working knowledge and understanding of data models
Experience defining strategies for data classification
Experience in training and communicating to internal stakeholders about data governance principles and best practices
Effective written, oral, interpersonal and relationship building skills, particularly with internal stakeholders.
Strong project and time management skills
Ability to apply data governance knowledge as an independent worker under minimal supervision
Nice to haves:
Experience using data governance tools or software (i.e. Collibra, etc.)
Bilingualism an asset (French/ English)
Ability to assess the impact decisions can have on end-users and overall functionality of systems
Ability to travel within Canada and internationally.
Our story:
ABOUT OXFORD PROPERTIES GROUP Oxford Properties Group connects people to exceptional places, and is the owner, developer and manager of some of the world’s best real estate assets. Established in 1960, it manages approximately $60 billion of assets across the globe on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Oxford’s portfolio encompasses office, retail, industrial, hotels and multifamily residential and spans over 100 million square feet in global gateway cities across four continents. A highly disciplined and thematic investor, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and platform opportunities across the risk-reward spectrum. With regional head offices in Toronto, New York, London, Luxembourg, Singapore and Sydney, its long-term approach to real estate investment aligns Oxford’s interests to its customers and the communities in which it operates. Oxford is the global real estate arm of OMERS, the AAA credit rated defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

Job Title: Sr. Data Analyst – Vendor Income Finance
Job Description:
Location:

1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?

The successful candidate will be working in a team responsible for central analytics, reporting and processing across the areas of Vendor Income, Vendor Audit and Top Vendor. They will also be supporting various Finance objectives focusing on maintaining controls, driving process efficiencies and data-driven insights. They will take ownership of and lead the VIF projects with various merchant teams to drive Vendor Income processes efficiently. The successful candidate will be instrumental in the continued development and enhancements related to SAP functionality.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the development, analysis, and communication of on-going and ad hoc financial information related to Vendor Income
Cooperate with various merchant teams to standardize processes such as the DSD to POS conversion, to ensure efficient and timely billing
Prepare weekly and quarterly periodic reports, variance analysis and reconciliations
Take large amounts of complex information from multiple sources and produce simple and easy-to-understand explanations of business results
Liaise and collaborate with various stakeholders (Vendors, Category, IT and Finance, etc.) to follow up on various inquiries and drive Finance initiatives
Contribute to on-going process improvements/enhancements to ensure data integrity and accuracy
Participate in department initiatives, special projects, and ad hoc analysis as required
Facilitate and outline clear business process maps and documentation
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or Post-Secondary education in Business, Accounting, Finance or Information/Computer science related disciplines
2-3 years of relevant work experience in the above disciplines
Have a strong understanding of relational database, and ability to build and manage databases
Strong technical and analytical skills with attention to detail while consistently processing information
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word)
Experience with the following: VBA, SQL, Python, SAS, R, Teradata and MicroStrategy would be an asset
Strong interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills; ability to effectively obtain information and communicate issues and requests to others
Highly motivated, pro-active, professional, and flexible with the ability to adapt to a complex and ever-changing environment
How You’ll Succeed:

At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.

If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Employment Type:

Full time

Type of Role:

Regular

Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Job Title: Senior Analyst/Associate, Data and Advanced Analytics
Job Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you invest your career in CPP Investment Board (CPPIB), you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $350 billion, CPPIB is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to exceed $450 billion by 2025. CPPIB invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.

CPPIB attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by CPPIB’s important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPPIB.

Job Description

We are hiring a Senior Analyst/Associate in the Data and Advanced Analytics team the Technology and Data department. In this role, you will combine your expertise in data analysis in asset management and real estate to support new data and analytics initiatives. You will be called on to find solutions to complicated data issues related to a variety of short and long term projects focused on bringing new data capabilities at CPPIB.
Support internal business partners (Investment Departments and Core Services) in the development and execution of new data capabilities.
Perform analysis and transformation of various internal and external data sets.
Leverage data visualization tools to represent the data in a business-friendly manner.
Help conduct and coordinate proof-of-concepts with external vendors alongside multiple internal stakeholders
Test and integrate APIs from external vendors.
Provide ongoing support for Data Governance capabilities such as metadata management, data quality and data stewardship/reporting.
Pro-actively communicate and collaborate with internal business clients to analyze functional requirements and deliver the appropriate artifacts as needed: business requirement documents, functional specifications, data specifications, use cases, workflow analysis, metrics, reports and user-interface layouts and designs.
Ensure that new enhancements address immediate business needs, while ensuring system alignment with data strategy and roadmaps.
Qualifications
Graduate or undergraduate degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. applied mathematics, financial economics, statistics, physics, engineering or computer science)
Solid programming experience in several of the following technologies: SQL, Python, Excel/VBA, nix or command batch scripts.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik or Power BI.
Experience working with AWS, Microsoft Azure or GCP considered an asset.
Experience in analyzing, manipulating, transforming, and interpreting large and complex datasets, structured and unstructured data in a variety of formats XML, JSON and structures such as time series and panel
Experience with market data vendors including Yardi, Argus, Simcorp.
Experience that demonstrates data knowledge across the following domains:
Real Asset valuations and or management
Private Equity Investment and monitoring
Data used in the investment process: fundamentals, estimates, valuations, industry KPIs, economic indicators
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to work individually as well as in a team environment
Demonstrated knowledge of the data lifecycle, including experience with data modeling and data quality
Commitment to CPPIB’s guiding principles of integrity, partnership and high performance
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on Linkedin. #LI-POST

At CPP Investment Board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investment Board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. Marketing Data Analyst

The Marketing Data Analyst will pair their Customer Relationship Marketing experience using digital channels with considerable skills in statistical data analysis to deliver valuable insights driven strategies for our internal teams and clients. In this role, you will be driven to find solutions for sophisticated challenges that span across creative, strategic, technical and analytical dimensions. He/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategies. He/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and technology platforms/toolsets. He/she will have an opportunity to work with industry leading big brands and grow their skills across the full spectrum of data science in the field of customer analytics.

You will:
Lead and support analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexities: including creating automated reports and dashboards, post campaign analysis/reports, ad hoc diagnostic analysis, developing profiling/scoring models and segmentation strategies, web analytics implementation, implementing multivariate testing, and quarterly and annual performance analysis presentations with senior leadership.
Assist in driving strategy for customer acquisition, loyalty and conversion by developing models, personas, forecasts, scores/indices to meet short/long term client objectives/goals.
Interpret analytics driven insights and recommend approaches and solutions that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project and client needs.
Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analysis and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in the digital advertising landscape.
Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, data enrichment, data integration and attribution processes, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.
Post campaign performance analysis using summary statistics and diagnostic contribution analysis across segments and variables using statistical techniques and models.
Creation of post campaign reports/presentations that are engaging, client-friendly, insightful, incorporating best practices in data visualization and story-telling, on an ad hoc/monthly/quarterly/yearly basis.

You Must Have:
A curious, self-starter, proactive mentality with a high ‘figure-it-out’ quotient.
Undergraduate degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, business analytics or marketing science is preferred.
2-4 years of full-stack analytics experience that ranges across data wrangling, data blending, data enrichment, descriptive and diagnostic data mining techniques, insights generation, and client presentations.
At least 1 year working experience on SQL Server, or other structured relational database platforms; and intermediate level of SQL skills.
Experience working with email marketing platforms such as Adobe Campaign, Exact target (Salesforce Marketing Cloud), Silver pop etc.
Experience with web analytics platforms such as Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics (Omniture), and a sound understanding of email/web metrics and experience with tag management platforms (DTM, GTM).
Working experience with data visualization platforms such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI or MicroStrategy.
Experience working with digital channels that include email, web, experiential, social or other channels that specifically involved customer level targeted experiences, product marketing experience is preferred.
Strong data visualization skills that adheres to industry established best practices, and presentation skills to simplify and package complex ideas into intuitive, decision driving client presentations.
Sound knowledge of CRM principles, strategies and ideologies around acquisition, conversion, loyalty, engagement, retention and attrition models, consumer journey optimizations, and lifecycle marketing.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate, prioritize, maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects.
Ability to be self-managed, work independently as well as to collaborate within an agile dynamic team environment.

Bonus Points for:
Sound understanding of application of various machine learning modelling techniques to appropriate business problems.
Experience designing, executing and analyzing experiments using multi-variate testing methodologies (full/fractional-factorial).
Expert knowledge digital consumer behaviour on quantitative/qualitative research platforms.
Experience working with advanced analytics/machine learning platforms such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS, Alteryx, Azure ML, AWS ML; and/or SSRS and SSAS.
Experience with ad tech integrations for Adobe Campaign, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Experience Manager and Google Analytics360.
Experience with analytics driven cross-selling, up-selling methodologies for technology products with long product life times, and/or consumer packaged goods with short product life times.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Data Analyst Team Lead

Citis Innovation labs is a global network of innovation centers focused on delivering cutting edge solutions to Citis Capital Markets, Securities Services and Banking lines of businesses.

Our Mission is to create a competitive advantage for our clients, manifested as change in the way they operate, by providing innovative technological solutions with strong client engagement, from idea to production, and by leveraging the entrepreneurship spirit.

We are currently looking for an excellent data analyst team lead to join one of our cutting edge trade surveillance solutions. It is a highly advanced trade monitoring and analytics product used globally among Citis trading desks.

Job Description
Recruit and Manage a team of talented data analysts
Explore and analyze datasets to develop new robust controls
Work with business partners to design new workflows to transform business requirements into concrete insights
Onboard data across the various financial markets via multiple consumption methods (Message buses, SFTP, SQL connectors)
Develop automated procedures to improve and optimize existing controls
Work together with the R&D team to help guide the Platform roadmap
Experience & Qualifications
Experience managing data/business analysts
Strong leadership and management skills
Ability to manage senior stakeholder relationships
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to details and accuracy
Solid experience in working with data and relational / non-relational databases
Hands-on experience in Scripting Languages (Python / R)
Experience in troubleshooting code and logs advantage
Experience in Linux Advantage
BS/BA in Software Engineering or Computer Science advantage, or in Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics
